original_title: Sri Lanka to ban building above 4 stories in Nuwara Eliya
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s cabinet had approved a ban on buildings above four storeys in the central hill town of Nuwara Eliya, as part of efforts to end unplanned expansion of the tourist resort city, Transport Minister Bandula Gunawardena said.
The Urban Development Authority has been given authority to issue required regulations.
The cabinet had also authorised the appointment of a task force to come up with an orderly plan for Nuwara Eliya taking into account environment and other factors, he said.
Nuwara Eliya known as Little England is a popular tourist spot dating back from the British Colonial period. (Colombo/April25/2023)
